Did you know that we offer packaging made of fallen leaves? ğŸƒ Itâ€™s the first day of Spring, and while fresh leaves are blooming, the fallen ones turn into packaging. ReleafÂ® uses leaves found on pavements, lawns and pathways to turn them into fibres with a combination of mechanical, thermal and chemical treatment. As a results, green mass transforms into raw materials with paper-forming properties which are later used to make bags, boxes, wrapping paper and more. Wondering how exactly it works? 1ï¸âƒ£ The leaves are collected from the cities, parks, sidewalks etc. 2ï¸âƒ£ The leaves are cleaned, dried and compressed, which allows for storing them all year around. 3ï¸âƒ£ With the use of special industrial equipment and mechanical, thermal and/or chemical treatment, the leaves are turned into paper-forming materials. 4ï¸âƒ£ The production of the paper, and the final products, begin. Packhelp offers a ReleafÂ® Paper Bag with the possibility of customisation. This way the bag is not only eco-friendly, but also reflects your branding and style.
